q: the attack.`` There has crept in our society and our public dialogue, a coarseness, a nastiness, an attack of people who don't share the same views as you do,'' he said. All sorts of nastiness. And it is not just politicians who are doing this to each other, and, frankly, politics has always been a contact sport in this country. but with all of the cable channels and talk radio and blogs, especially blogs, where people can be anonymous with their nastiness, I think has caused a level of coarseness in our society that we've all got to think about. Colin Powell said he thought Barack Obama was making an effort to reach across political divides to tone down the rhetoric and urged members of Congress to do the same. NASDAQ: GOOG) today announced financial results for the quarter and the fiscal year ended December 31, 2010.`` Q4 marked a terrific end to a stellar year,'' said Eric Schmidt , CEO of Google. Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth-- investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider web. announced plans to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a statement.`` By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company.
